comment._content: The Dutch Treat Club is still around and still using that logo: www.dutchtreatclub.org/

comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: The illustrator's initials are "JMF", that must be James Montgomery Flagg, one of the founders of the club.

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Vintage Monocle, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: There are three Bain News Service Photos captioned “Dutch Treat Club in Annual Feast and Frolic” in the March 8, 1914, New York Times. Included is a photo of James Montgomery Flagg “As He Seemed to the Dutch Treaters”. Appearing in the other photographs is Jack Hines, Miss Dorothy Meyers, Arthur William Brown, G. B. Baker, J. W. Adams, H. G. Dart and A. B. Walker. — From The Library of Congress American Memory Collection.
